Class VirtualDiskSpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl.VirtualDiskSpace

extends java.lang.Object

      private static class  VirtualDiskSpace.VirtualDiskSpacePosition

      • load

        public static IVirtualDiskSpace load(IVirtualDisk disk,
                     long position)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a VirtualDiskSpace located at the given offset position in the IVirtualDisk.
        Parameters:
        disk - the disk from which the VirtualDiskSpace should be loaded.
        position - the offset position in bytes at which the VirtualDiskSpace is stored.
        Returns:
        the loaded VirtualDiskSpace
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a VirtualDiskSpace at the given offset position in the IVirtualDisk with the specified amount of space in bytes.
        Parameters:
        disk - the disk in which the VirtualDiskSpace should be created.
        size - the size of the newly created VirtualDiskSpace
        Returns:
        the newly created VirtualDiskSpace
        Throws:

      • getVirtualDiskPosition

        public long getVirtualDiskPosition()
        Returns the position (address) of the space inside the virtual disk. The position 0 would be the first byte of the virtual disk.
        Specified by:
        getVirtualDiskPosition in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Returns:
        the position (address) of the space inside the virtual disk.

      • changeSize

        public void changeSize(long newSize)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the size of the disk space. If the new size is smaller than the current size, the additional space is marked as free. If the newSize is bigger, additional DataBlocks are allocated and added to the disk space.
        Specified by:
        changeSize in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Parameters:
        newSize - the new size of the disk space
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

        java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        the usable size of the disk space

      • getDiskSize

        public long getDiskSize()
        Returns the amount of bytes which are needed to represent the disk space including all the meta data used to store the data blocks on the virtual disk.
        Specified by:
        getDiskSize in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Returns:
        the disk space used by the virtual space on the virtual disk in bytes.

      • getPosition

        public long getPosition()
        Returns the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Returns:
        the offset position.

      • seek

        public void seek(long pos)
        Sets the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space. The offset may be set beyond the end of the disk space. Setting the offset beyond the end of the disk space does not change the disk space size. The disk space size will change only by writing after the offset has been set beyond the end of the disk space.
        Specified by:
        seek in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space.

      • write

           throws java.io.IOException

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads up to b.length bytes of bytes from the disk space into an array of bytes starting at the current offset.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        Returns:

        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • free

        public void free()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Frees all the DataBlocks used by the disk space. The virtual space can't be used after it has been freed.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IVirtualDiskSpace
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
